intro: Parinari pilosa, commonly known as the hairy parinari, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and dark green, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, round, red berries that are a source of food for various wildlife. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
